Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2010 07:52PM marshamulvey wrote: I am fairly new to this disease also having been diagnosed on February 10, 2010.  This is not a recurrence, my first round with cancer and it was already Stage IV.  My onc is in a fairly large group that discuss the more difficult cases to devise a treatment plan.  Their best guess as to how long this had been growing within me was "only 5 - 6 months".  When you consider a 6cm tumor in the breast, many lymph nodes, numerous tumors in the liver, a few spots in the bones, and skin involvement, I'll do whatever treatments they believe I should do.  It is sometimes depressing to think about, but when you know how quickly it can grow and spread, it makes it all worthwhile. My initial treatment was a weekly combination of Taxol, Herceptin, (and Zometa  once every four weeks).  After 10 straight weeks, we stopped the Taxol.  I've now had 12 weeks of Herceptin (+Zometa).  My scans are showing significant improvement (shrinkage) everywhere, with the spots in the bones stable.  If I can continue to enjoy life I'll gladly accept the regimen the doctors set forth for me.  Someday, I may not be able to fight, so as long as I'm able, I will. Best wishes to all.    MM
Posts.Title: Will I Always be "In Treatment"? dharmamama Lowrider54
